---

## GHQ 12 vs SF-36

Harmony can help psychologists and social scientists compare GHQ 12 vs SF-36. This innovative software utilises natural language processing and generative AI models to match related items from the General Health Questionnaire (GHQ-12) and the Short Form Health Survey (SF-36), among others, even across multiple languages. In many psychological and social studies, there's a need for comparative and longitudinal analysis. Practitioners wanting to do a comparative study involving GHQ 12 vs SF-36 can leverage Harmony's capabilities for efficient harmonisation. The software uses large language models to compare instruments, providing a percentage match between each correlating item in GHQ 12 and SF-36. With Harmony, researchers can cross-verify results across studies under varying social conditions. When considering GHQ 12 vs SF-36, Harmony's user-friendly database and drag-and-drop feature certainly stand out, replacing traditional ways of manually going through long questionnaires. Just visit [Harmony's web Interface](https://harmonydata.ac.uk/app) and see for yourself. Try comparing GHQ 12 vs SF-36 today using Harmony and make your research process more convenient and efficient.
